result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Review hearing on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Brent M Johnson in court with attorney Ryan J. Harrington.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery.
Defense requests an examination under Wis. Stats. 971.16.
Court orders examination under Wis. Stats. 971.16 be completed by Dr. Collins and a report filed accordingly.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on April 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:27 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing with 21CM1389 & 22CM298.  Defendant Brent M Johnson in court with attorney Ryan J. Harrington.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court notes the matter is set for hearing on Atty. Harrington's Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Harrington presents statements; he advises he is withdrawing his motion at this time but reserves the right to renew his motion if needed at a later date.  Court notes that the bail conditions are not the same in all 3 cases.  Atty. Harrington confirms the motion would only be with respect to the 2 newer cases, not 21CM1389.  Court will accept the withdraw of the bail motion based on a change in circumstances.  Court notes that this matter is currently set for further proceedings on 04/01/2022 but the 2 newer cases are set for 04/20/2022.  Atty. Harrington requests all matters be set for further proceedings on 04/20/2022.  Court will schedule all 3 cases accordingly.
Bail/bond hearing on March 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Motion to Modify Bail Conditions of Bail, filed by Attorney Ryan J. Harrington

09:38 AM Defendant Brent M Johnson in court with attorney Ryan J. Harrington.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Harrington previously filed a motion to modify bail conditions.  Attorney Harrington makes arguments in support of his motion to modify bail conditions.  Attorney Harrington is asking for the defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A so that the defendant may be allowed to return to his residence.  The defendant's mother, Robin Johnson, and father, David Johnson, appear in Court and both make statements regarding the request for a no violent contact order.  The State objects to any modification of bail.  The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Harrington intends on reaching out to the Judge's Clerk in order to get a quick date to readdress bail before an available Judge considering there is no calendar scheduled before Judge Bohren through next week.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail filed by Atty. Ryan Harrington
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty. Ryan Harrington
